abstract: In a proxy statement filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission, Charter said the risk of regulatory rejection of the merger made it in the interest of Time Warner Cable shareholders to turn down the deal.
snippet: In a proxy statement filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission, Charter said the risk of regulatory rejection of the merger made it in the interest of Time Warner Cable shareholders to turn down the deal.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Charter Communications, which was rebuffed last year when it proposed a merger with Time Warner Cable, then lost out to Comcast in a bidding competition for the cable company, is urging the Time Warner Cable shareholders to reject the $45 billion deal with Comcast.

headline.main: Charter Challenges Comcast-Time Warner Cable Deal
headline.print_headline: Charter Challenges Comcast-Time Warner Cable Deal
